info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 5:16PM EDT until July 12 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton NY
info.description:
FFWBGM
The National Weather Service in Binghamton has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Pike County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania...
* Until 700 PM EDT.
* At 516 PM EDT, 911 dispatch has reported multiple roads flooded in the area, including I84 eastbound near exit 17. Between 4 and 5 inches of rain has already fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sterling, Greentown, Ledgerdale, Angels, Newfoundland and Panther.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Moss Hollow Creek, Bridge Creek, Wallenpaupack Creek, Roaring Brook, Mozette Creek, West Branch Wallenpaupack Creek, Wilcox Creek, East Branch Wallenpaupack Creek and Jones Creek.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 7:00 PM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 7:00 PM EDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 7:00 PM EDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 7:00 PM EDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
